title: Donald Faison and Zach Braff have Scrubs reunion on Instagram
text:
They starred together on the popular sitcom Scrubs, which aired from October 2001 to March 2010.

But it appears that the love is not lost nearly a decade after filming stopped as Donald Faison and Zach Braff smiled for a shot shared on Instagram Tuesday morning.

Zach, 44, wore a yellow blazer and wrapped his arm around Donald, 45, for the impromptu reunion.

Friends forever: The love is not lost nearly a decade after filming stopped on Scrubs as Donald Faison and Zach Braff smiled for a shot shared on Instagram Tuesday morning

'And you said you didn’t want no Scrubs?' Donald captioned the photo, playing on the lyrics from the popular TLC song.

The pair shared the ultimate bromance on television screens for nine seasons of the popular medical comedy.

Zach narrated the show and also portrayed young physician John Michael J.D. Dorian, who started the series as a staff intern.

Donald's character, Christopher Turk, was J.D.'s best friend and a surgeon, who began on the series as an intern and climbed his way up to chief of surgery.

Besties: The pair shared the ultimate bromance on television screens for nine seasons of the popular medical comedy

Funny guys: Zach narrated the show and also portrayed young physician John Michael J.D. Dorian, who started the series as a staff intern

Throughout the nine seasons of the show, Turk and J.D.'s friendship is highlighted with hilarious antics as Scrubs earned top marks.

The show first started on the NBC network for seven seasons before making a switch to ABC in 2009, only to be canceled a year later after its ninth and final season.

Scrubs earned a staggering 17 Emmy nominations throughout its run, including a nod for Outstanding Comedy Series during its fourth season.

Entertainment Weekly gave the series an A- grade while IGN gave the program a 10 for its first season and a slew of 9's the following years.
